title: Generate and Edit Images with OpenAI's GPT-Image-1 Model
author: Edoardo Guzzi

final","type":"n8n-nodes-base.convertToFile","position":[820,-40],"parameters":{"options":{"fileName":"","mimeType":"image/png"},"operation":"toBinary","sourceProperty":"data[0].b64_json"},"typeVersion":1.1},{"id":"3d3238d5-6040-4b74-8e6a-9e1e64198099","name":"Sticky Note","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[-500,-200],"parameters":{"height":320,"content":"### 🧪 Manual Trigger
Starts the workflow manually. Ideal for testing and debugging purposes.
"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"c3378100-f688-4199-a038-83b9220afa91","name":"Sticky Note1","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[-200,-320],"parameters":{"color":3,"width":280,"height":440,"content":"### 🎨 Image Generation (OpenAI)
Sends a POST request to the OpenAI `/v1/images/generations` endpoint.

- Uses `gpt-image-1` model
- Generates an image from a given prompt
- Returns a base64-encoded image (`b64_json`)

📌 Output: `data[0].b64_json`
"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"82a880de-74de-44e5-8448-f487c9376d0e","name":"Sticky Note2","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[100,-200],"parameters":{"color":5,"width":280,"height":320,"content":"### 🧾 Convert base64 to File
Converts the `b64_json` field into a binary PNG file to use in the next step.

📤 Output: Binary image under the `data` field
"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"42ccb29f-b820-4791-9683-4eb0f00ff2d3","name":"Sticky Note3","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[420,-320],"parameters":{"color":3,"width":280,"height":440,"content":"### ✏️ Image Editing (OpenAI)
Sends the binary image to OpenAI’s `/v1/images/edits` endpoint with a descriptive prompt.

- Model: `gpt-image-1`
- Format: `multipart/form-data`
- Requires a real file (not base64)
- Supports optional `mask` input

📥 Input: Binary image from `data`
📤 Output: Edited image in `b64_json`
"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"4c8846ab-b3f2-4c7c-9283-5a40a55b816d","name":"Sticky Note4","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[740,-240],"parameters":{"color":5,"width":280,"height":360,"content":"### 🧾 Final Conversion (base64 → File)
Converts the edited image (`b64_json`) into a downloadable or previewable PNG file.

📤 Output: Final binary image
"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"2b2533f8-b7aa-4499-970e-9b0546b73c0e","name":"Sticky Note5","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[-1240,-860],"parameters":{"color":6,"width":700,"height":980,"content":"## 🧠 Image AI Workflow Overview

This workflow uses OpenAI's image generation and editing APIs with the `gpt-image-1` model.

### 🔑 Requirements:
- You **must use your own OpenAI API key** from https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys
- Create a credential in n8n called `OpenAi AIFB account` (or use your own name)

---

### 💰 Cost Warning:
- This model is **powerful but expensive**.
- Each image costs **$0.020 to $0.190** depending on resolution and type.
- Always monitor your usage via the [OpenAI dashboard](https://platform.openai.com/account/usage)

---

### 🔍 Why use `gpt-image-1`?
- Unmatched **semantic control**: you can edit specific parts of images with detailed prompts.
- Supports **multiple input images**, coherent edits, and future multi-modal tasks.
- Editing works with or without a transparency `mask`.

---

### 🔧 Suggested Nodes to Expand Workflow:
- **Webhook** (trigger via your frontend or app)
- **Telegram / Slack** (prompt image generation from chat)
- **Set node** (inject dynamic prompts or user context)
- **IF / Switch** (change behavior depending on prompt type)
- **Merge** (combine multiple image generations)
- **HTTP Request** (send generated images to external APIs or CMS)

---

### 💡 Example Use Cases:
- Marketing teams: generate product visuals on demand
- Designers: edit and re-style illustrations without Photoshop
- E-commerce: dynamic generation of themed mockups
- Content creators: create blog and social thumbnails in bulk

---

> ⚠️ Don't forget to add rate limiting or batch controls if generating large volumes!
"},"typeVersion":1}],"pinData":{},"connections":{"Create image call":{"main":[[{"node":"Convert json binary to File","type":"main","index":0}]]},"Edit Image (OpenAI)":{"main":[[{"node":"Convert json binary to File final","type":"main","index":0}]]},"Convert json binary to File":{"main":[[{"node":"Edit Image (OpenAI)","type":"main","index":0}]]},"When clicking ‘Test workflow’":{"main":[[{"node":"Create image call","type":"main","index":0}]]}}}
readme:
This template integrates OpenAI's image generation and editing endpoints via the GPT-Image-1 model to visually create and manipulate images based on prompts. It features base64 conversion, binary handling, and prompt chaining.

Perfect for marketing, design, product visuals and creative workflows.

**🛠️ Requirements**  
OpenAI account with access to gpt-image-1(probably you need organizations verifications for access to that model)

OpenAI API credentials configured in n8n

A self-hosted or cloud n8n instance

Basic familiarity with the n8n UI (no programming required)

**🔧 Step-by-step Instructions**

Step 1: Manual Trigger  
Starts the workflow on click. Ideal for testing the generation and edit logic.

Step 2: Generate Image  
The Create image call node sends a prompt to OpenAI and returns a base64 image.

**Example prompt:**

A cyberpunk city at night with flying cars and neon lights

**Step 3: Convert to Binary**  
The base64 image is converted into a usable binary PNG file with the Convert json binary to File node.

**Step 4: Edit the Image**  
The binary file is passed to OpenAI’s /images/edits endpoint. A new prompt applies changes to the image.

**Example:**

Add a glowing robot in the foreground with a neon sword

✅ Supports model: gpt-image-1  
⚠️ Requires binary file (not base64)

**Step 5: Final Conversion**  
Converts the final edited image from base64 to file so it can be downloaded or used in other nodes.

**🎯 Real-World Use Cases**  
🎨 Artists & Creators: concept art and illustration variations

🛍️ E-commerce: auto-generate product mockups

📰 Marketing: create eye-catching blog or social visuals

**💡 Bonus Ideas**  
Add a Telegram or Slack node to generate or edit images via chat

Use a Webhook to feed prompts from a form or frontend

Add a mask to restrict edits to specific areas (e.g., background only)
readme_html:
This template integrates OpenAI's image generation and editing endpoints via the GPT-Image-1 model to visually create and manipulate images based on prompts. It features base64 conversion, binary handling, and prompt chaining.

Perfect for marketing, design, product visuals and creative workflows.

🛠️ Requirements
OpenAI account with access to gpt-image-1(probably you need organizations verifications for access to that model)

OpenAI API credentials configured in n8n

A self-hosted or cloud n8n instance

Basic familiarity with the n8n UI (no programming required)

🔧 Step-by-step Instructions

Step 1: Manual Trigger
Starts the workflow on click. Ideal for testing the generation and edit logic.

Step 2: Generate Image
The Create image call node sends a prompt to OpenAI and returns a base64 image.

Example prompt:

A cyberpunk city at night with flying cars and neon lights

Step 3: Convert to Binary
The base64 image is converted into a usable binary PNG file with the Convert json binary to File node.

Step 4: Edit the Image
The binary file is passed to OpenAI’s /images/edits endpoint. A new prompt applies changes to the image.

Example:

Add a glowing robot in the foreground with a neon sword

✅ Supports model: gpt-image-1
⚠️ Requires binary file (not base64)

Step 5: Final Conversion
Converts the final edited image from base64 to file so it can be downloaded or used in other nodes.

🎯 Real-World Use Cases
🎨 Artists & Creators: concept art and illustration variations

🛍️ E-commerce: auto-generate product mockups

📰 Marketing: create eye-catching blog or social visuals

💡 Bonus Ideas
Add a Telegram or Slack node to generate or edit images via chat

Use a Webhook to feed prompts from a form or frontend

Add a mask to restrict edits to specific areas (e.g., background only)
readme_zh:
该模板通过GPT-Image-1模型整合了OpenAI的图像生成与编辑接口，可根据提示词实现可视化创作与图像处理。具备base64格式转换、二进制处理及提示词串联功能，特别适合营销宣传、设计创作、产品可视化等创意工作流。

**🛠️ 使用前提**  
• 已开通GPT-Image-1访问权限的OpenAI账户（通常需通过企业认证）  
• 在n8n中配置好的OpenAI API凭证  
• 本地或云端部署的n8n实例  
• 熟悉n8n基础界面操作（无需编程）  

**🔧 分步指南**  
1. **手动触发**  
点击启动工作流，适合测试生成与编辑逻辑  

2. **生成图像**  
通过Create image节点发送提示词至OpenAI，返回base64格式图像  
**示例提示词**：  
"霓虹闪烁的赛博朋克夜城，空中悬浮车穿梭"  

3. **转为二进制**  
使用Convert json binary to File节点将base64图像转换为可操作的PNG二进制文件  

4. **编辑图像**  
将二进制文件传至OpenAI的/images/edits接口，通过新提示词修改图像  
**示例**：  
"在前景添加手持霓虹光剑的发光机器人"  
✅ 支持模型：gpt-image-1  
⚠️ 必须使用二进制文件（非base64）  

5. **最终转换**  
将编辑后的base64图像转为文件格式，便于下载或供其他节点使用  

**🎯 应用场景**  
🎨 艺术创作：概念图与插画变体生成  
🛍️ 电商：自动生成产品效果图  
📰 营销：制作吸睛的博客/社交媒体视觉  

**💡 扩展玩法**  
• 接入Telegram/Slack节点实现聊天式图像生成  
• 通过Webhook从表单/前端获取提示词  
• 添加蒙版限定编辑区域（如仅修改背景）
title_zh: 使用OpenAI的GPT-Image-1模型生成与编辑图像

- **Set node** (inject dynamic prompts or user context)

- **HTTP Request** (send generated images to external APIs or CMS)

- Content creators: create blog and social thumbnails in bulk
